page.title: 20The Birmingham Canal systems
page.content: The system in Birmingham was built to exploit{coal and iron resources}of the area. The railways superceeded canals which are not now used for industrial transport.{The West Midlands County Council}is promoting the canals with a view to{recreational purposes}. Various cruising and towpath walks have been given in{a special information leaflet} which highlights historical and scenic routes to the visitor. In this area there are two canals which join in {Kings Norton}. The Birmingham and Worcester Canal has about 5 miles of towpath from here to the city centre. The Stratford on Avon Canal also has an interesting scenic walk. At Kings Norton there are some moorings for longboats and a sanitary station for boat users who are often {holiday makers or canal enthusiasts}. Canals are being improved for public use.
